article.headline: Davidson 67, The Citadel 49
article.story: CHARLESTON, S.C. (AP) -- Brendan Winters scored 18 points and pulled down eight rebounds as Davidson won its first road game of the season with a 67-49 victory over The Citadel on Tuesday night. The Wildcats pulled down 46 rebounds -- 22 more than The Citadel and shot 44.9 percent (22-of-49) compared to 32.7 percent (17-of-52) for the Bulldogs. Davidson (10-11, 5-5 Southern Conference) started the game with a 17-3 run. The Citadel (4-16, 0-9) cut the deficit to 24-21 before the Wildcats went on an 18-7 run to put the game away for good. Matt McKillop added 15 points for Davidson and Logan Kosmalski had 11 points and a game-high nine rebounds. The Citadel was led by Erick Wilson's 18 points, including five 3-pointers.
